explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Classified in UNRTDG No.: 1736, Class: 8, PGII

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen and chlorine (but not fluorine) and these elements are chemically bonded only to carbon (but not to other elements).

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Since both targeted two or more rat LD50 values: 1140-2618 mg/kg (unknown sex) (ACGIH (7th, 2001)), 3619mg/kg (male) and 1900 (female) (DFGOT vol.6 (1994)) had no reason which should be excluded, statisticals calculation was performed. 1453 mg/kg was obtained as a calculation value. It was set as Category 4 based on the classification standards.

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: It was set as Category 3 based on the lower value of 790 mg/kg which is from rabbit LD50 = 790 - >2000mg/kg (ACGIH (2001)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Taking the lowest value of 247ppm for rat LC50 (4h) = 247ppm - >377ppm (ACGIH (7th, 2001)), the gaseous Category standard value was applied, and it was classified as Category 2.

skin_corrosion_irritation.hazard_statement: Causes severe skin burns and eye damage
skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: As a result of rabbit test, it was judged to be "extremely irritating" or "corrosive" (ACGIH and (7th, 2001) and IUCLID (2000)). There is a description of burn and blister with exposure to the skin also on humans (ICSC (2002)). Therefore, since it was thought to cause irreversible damage to the skin, it was classified as Category 1A-1C.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: It is estimated "extremely irritating" or "corrosive" by the test result using a rabbit (ACGIH and (7th, 2001), IUCLID (2000), HSDB (2000)), and humans also have description of the severe burn by eyes exposures (ICSC (2002)). Therefore, since it was thought that critical damage was caused to an eye, it was set as Category 1.

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitization: Classification not possible; Skin sensitization: Classification not possible
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: [Respiratory sensitization] No data [Skin sensitization] No data

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the negative result (HSDB (2005)) in the somatic cell in vivo mutagenicity test (micronucleus examination which used mouse bone-marrow erythroblasts), we classified it as Out Of Category.

carcinogenicity.rationale: Based on being classified into A4 (1995) according to ACGIH, it carried out the outside of Category. In addition, the classification of IARC is classified into 2A as a mixture with alpha-chlorinated toluenes. However, benzoyl chloride is estimated as "There is inadequate evidence in experimental animals". This is equivalent to a group 3.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: There is the statement about symptoms causing inhalation exposure in human such as cough, constrained respiration, pharyngeal pain (HSDB (2005)), addition to mucosal irritation (ACGIH (2001)), causticity of respiratory (ICSC (2002), SITTIG (47th, 2002)). Moreover, it is stated that pulmonary oedemas with a possibility of serious result is caused (ICSC (2002), SITTIG (47th, 2002)). It is classified into Category 2 (respiratory tract systems) based on the above fact.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Causes damage to organs (respiratory organs) through prolonged or repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: It was classified to as Category 1 (respiratory systems) based on that the symptoms such as chronic pharyngitis, chronic sinusitis, and a olfaction disorder are reported in the human occupational exposure (ACGIH (2001),HSDB (2005)), and that significant respiratory irritant,mild hypertrophy tonsils is admitted in the repetitive exposure examination of the mouse (ACGIH, 2001),IUCLID (2000)) .

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 96-hour LC50=0.12mg/L of Crustacea (glass shrimp) (ECETOC TR91, 2003).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since rapidly degrading (it hydrolyzed and benzoic acid (BOD: 85%) is generated (Existing Chemicals Safety Check Data)), and supposed less bio-accumulative (log Kow=1.44 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)).
